name: Victorian Boston Stay in GREAT location
summary: This lovely Queen Anne Victorian home is situated on historic Wellesley Park near the base of Ashmont Hill in Dorchester. Experience a walk through this remarkably preserved Victorian era "garden suburb", passing by the original gas lights on the way to public transportation (The Red Line's Shawmut Station is a 3 min walk), and the many amenities this neighborhood offers. Red Line T offers easy/fast access to downtown Boston, Back Bay, financial district, Tufts, BU Medical and Mass General.
space: Sunny single room is the first one on the second floor with easy access to renovated full bathroom. Kitchen access is allowed. Room has a small refrigerator. 1/2 bath is at bottom of stairs. Street parking is plentiful and no permit needed.
description: This lovely Queen Anne Victorian home is situated on historic Wellesley Park near the base of Ashmont Hill in Dorchester. Experience a walk through this remarkably preserved Victorian era "garden suburb", passing by the original gas lights on the way to public transportation (The Red Line's Shawmut Station is a 3 min walk), and the many amenities this neighborhood offers. Red Line T offers easy/fast access to downtown Boston, Back Bay, financial district, Tufts, BU Medical and Mass General. Sunny single room is the first one on the second floor with easy access to renovated full bathroom. Kitchen access is allowed. Room has a small refrigerator. 1/2 bath is at bottom of stairs. Street parking is plentiful and no permit needed. Hosts live in the property and work in the area. They are available by cell phone if they happen to be out of the house. Easy T access, GREAT food options, Boston's best Vietnamese restaurants, authentic Irish Pubs, Zaggats rated Homestead bakery and café. Welles
neighborhood_overview: Easy T access, GREAT food options, Boston's best Vietnamese restaurants, authentic Irish Pubs, Zaggats rated Homestead bakery and café. Wellesley Park is a very peaceful and quiet oasis within the city! Strolling through the immediate neighborhood with it's garden parks is a nice way to unwind.
notes: NA
transit: Shawmut T stop (Red Line) is about 1/10 of a mile to it's front entry. It's about a 3-4 minute walk to the front entrance.  Many restaurants and retail are less than 1/4 of a mile from front door.
access: NA
interaction: Hosts live in the property and work in the area. They are available by cell phone if they happen to be out of the house.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Joe and Whit own this house in Wellfleet. Cape Cod is our favorite place in the world. We want to rent this place to help pay the bills, but we also want to share it because it's so cute and it makes us sad to have it empty when we aren't there. You may not actually meet us, but we look forward to talking to you on the telephone!

name: The Boston Room at Adams Village
summary: This private bedroom is on the 2nd floor of our home and is gorgeously renovated with cozy touches making it feel very comfortable! It’s on the 2nd floor so very private and quiet. The shared bathroom is directly across the hall which is also gorgeously renovated  and includes space to store private items. The bedroom includes a queen size bed, large closet with plenty of shelving, dresser and full length mirror.
space: Our home is a beautiful 3000 Sq Ft Victorian house built in 1890, which we completely renovated ourselves over the last four years. Our home is spacious and comfortable, with 4 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, a finished basement apartment, an open concept kitchen area designed for entertaining, a second living area, where we relax and watch movies and finally a gorgeous recently built wrap around stone patio with lounge furniture, dining area, chill chairs and a grill. We are located in Adams Village and a 7 minute walk to the Ashmont T-stop and a block away from numerous bars and restaurants, convenience stores and coffee shops. Our house is on a super private one way street but we are right around the corner from fun and convenience! Parking on our street is free and allowed. The neighborhood is extremely safe and our block is quiet.  The Boston Room: This private bedroom is on the 2nd floor of our home and is gorgeously renovated with cozy touches making it very comfortable! It’s on the 2n
description: This private bedroom is on the 2nd floor of our home and is gorgeously renovated with cozy touches making it feel very comfortable! It’s on the 2nd floor so very private and quiet. The shared bathroom is directly across the hall which is also gorgeously renovated  and includes space to store private items. The bedroom includes a queen size bed, large closet with plenty of shelving, dresser and full length mirror. Our home is a beautiful 3000 Sq Ft Victorian house built in 1890, which we completely renovated ourselves over the last four years. Our home is spacious and comfortable, with 4 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, a finished basement apartment, an open concept kitchen area designed for entertaining, a second living area, where we relax and watch movies and finally a gorgeous recently built wrap around stone patio with lounge furniture, dining area, chill chairs and a grill. We are located in Adams Village and a 7 minute walk to the Ashmont T-stop and a block away from numerous bars and re
neighborhood_overview: We are right in the heart of Adams Village, one of the 12 villages of Dorchester. The house is one block distance to Adams Village square. This is a historical area of Boston, where wealthy land owners, architects and big business owners used to live back in the day. Today, Adams Village has become a hip neighborhood with a non stop inflow of young professional and young families, due to the beautiful homes and accessible prices found here. There are 12 great restaurants you can go to within about 10 min walking from the house. They range from amazing craft beer selection bars to nice steaks houses. You will find something to eat. Ask us about favorites!
notes: Need a RENTAL CAR to cruise around? Check out our luxury listing on Turo and pick up the car right where you have breakfast, down the stairs! Our Jaguar F-Pace is all you need for any season of the year.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  We have two other private room available in the same house-  *THE STUDY AT ADAMS VILLAGE* https://abnb.me/gKJFycP74W *THE CLOUD ROOM* https://abnb.me/wtaUYIC74W We are pet lovers, so you will find species of friendly creatures living here: -The dogs: Monstra and Loba are our friendly Labradors and love meeting new friends, so you most likely find them begging for attention and also for food. But they are tricksters, dont let them fool you, they know guests are not supposed to feed them :).  -The cats: both Coconut and Butterscoth likely will not to give you the pleasure of their company as they are always hiding in the cellar, from the dogs.. Please keep you bedroom door tightly shut to keep the pets out of your room! They love attention and warm beds. :)
transit: To commute from and to Boston: By train: -you are a 7 min walk to the Red Line Ashmont T station. Once at the station your commute will be about 20-25 min to downtown Boston Driving:  -the highway is literally a few blocks out. I-93 will take you to Boston in about 10 min (no traffic) or about 25 min(with traffic). Parking on our street is free and allowed.
access: Guests are welcome to access all common areas of the house (kitchen, front living room, bathrooms) and including our gorgeous and large outdoor patio. Guests shared bathroom (full bathroom including shower) is on the 2nd floor. We also have a half bathroom (toilet/sink) on the 1st floor available for use. The private areas of our home include all other bedrooms and the back den/living room on the first floor, as well as the basement.
interaction: Check in is anytime after 3pm and check out is 11am. Guests will be emailed a unique code to use with our smart lock keypad. Although check in times can be flexible we would love the opportunity to welcome you to our house and personally show you around and introduce you to our loving dogs!  We will be as engaging as you would like us to be. If you would like to be private and focus on whatever task you have at hand, no worries! But if you do feel like interacting with other humans, there is usually something going on around the kitchen, whether it is a Patriots game night, or just friends chilling over a freshly made Negroni after a work's day! However we do respect quiet times after midnight and we are always available via phone or text to assist with guests needs.
house_rules: - NO ADDITIONAL GUESTS. Only guests included in the reservation are permitted inside our home - Clean dishes and pans after using the kitchen - Don't eat inside bedroom - Please dont feed dogs as their stomach might get upset - Avoid loud noise after midnight - Quiet hours are between 12am-7am - No heavy/greasy cooking in the kitchen. Please, if you spill things on the stovetop, clean it up. Do not leave spills to bake onto the stovetop, which makes them hard or impossible to clean off. -  Due to danger of fire, no candles, space heaters, or open flames may be used in the house. -  Please don't leave your laundry unattended, as other guests might need to use washer/dryer. -  When you are done using the kitchen, please leave no dishes or food in the sink, on counters, on the stove, or in any common area. Either wash your dishes or put them in the dishwasher. The kitchen should look as though you were never there. - The shared bathroom is used by others, so please help us keep the bathro
host_about: We are Fabricio and Christy - husband and wife. We recently married in 2018. We live in Boston with our two pups. We are hosts on Air B&B as well and love to travel! Fabricio is from Brazil and Christy is from Minnesota but we have lived in Boston now for over 15 years and love our city! We are super respectful and will treat any property we stay in as if it were our own.

name: Inviting and warm 2 bedroom Apt Near Train Station
summary: Our warm and inviting one bedroom is located on the first floor of our owner occupied home in Dorchester, Boston Massachusetts. Guests have the private room for their use and share a fully furnished kitchen and bathroom with other guests. The room has a new queen size bed and the living room has a new sofa bed. There's a five minute walk to the Red Line train and twenty minutes ride to Downtown Boston. A supermarket and restaurants are within walking distance.
space: A warm and inviting one bedroom  and one bathroom located on the 1st floor of our owner occupied victorian home in the historic town of Dorchester, Boston Massachusetts. The great thing about this room is, there are no stairs to climb to get to it. Our apartment has new appliances and furnishings. It has fast Wifi, a fully furnished eat-in kitchen, cable TV,  and free parking on the street.
description: Our warm and inviting one bedroom is located on the first floor of our owner occupied home in Dorchester, Boston Massachusetts. Guests have the private room for their use and share a fully furnished kitchen and bathroom with other guests. The room has a new queen size bed and the living room has a new sofa bed. There's a five minute walk to the Red Line train and twenty minutes ride to Downtown Boston. A supermarket and restaurants are within walking distance. A warm and inviting one bedroom  and one bathroom located on the 1st floor of our owner occupied victorian home in the historic town of Dorchester, Boston Massachusetts. The great thing about this room is, there are no stairs to climb to get to it. Our apartment has new appliances and furnishings. It has fast Wifi, a fully furnished eat-in kitchen, cable TV,  and free parking on the street. Guest can access the apartment by using a keypad lock and will have a key for their private room. We're sociable and don't mind interacting w
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a residential and diverse community with many ethnic restaurants in walking distance. There is a plaza seven minutes away that has a supermarket, MacDonald and other stores. The park and gas station are across the  street from the plaza. Our historic Franklin Park is ten minutes away and our famous Castle Island is a beautiful place to have a picnic and enjoy the beach.  South Bay mall is fifteen minutes away, it has a movie theatre and restaurants. The Spirit of Boston and Odyssey are fun ways to enjoy a tour of Boston on the ocean, have dinner and dance.  There are many fun tours and site seeing in Boston, such as the Freedom trail, Boston Duck Tours and Bunker Hill Monument.
notes: Renovations will be done on our owner occupied apartment for two weeks starting on April 2nd during the day.
transit: The Red Line train is located five minutes from home, it takes twenty minutes to get to Downtown Boston, Boston Commons, JFK/UMASS and  MIT.  It takes  about thirty minutes to get to Harvard University, Boston University, Mass General hospital, Brigham and Women's hospital and Children's hospital.
access: Guest can access the apartment by using a keypad lock and will have a key for their private room.
interaction: We're sociable and don't mind interacting with our guest.
house_rules: NA
host_about:
I am an educator, who enjoys empowering children, so they can soar like eagles. It brings me great joy when a child looks at me and say, I got it teacher, I got it! 
I love to cook and entertain friends and family when time permits. I love to sing and from time to time I will sing at different venues. I love football, basketball, and baseball.  I also enjoy watching movies, reading and travelling with my husband to new places.  I'm looking forward to making my guests feel at home!

name: Studio/Private Kitchen close to Downtown Boston
summary: Dear guest Well come to our house. The space- Big beautiful Victorian house on three floors. There are other more rooms on Airbnb. You will meet other guests in the house. On the back of the house there is a patio with picnic table for common use .  Interior- Beautiful hardwood floors, warm and welcoming colors. Equipped kitchen. Room- Has queen size bed, desk, lamp, closet, comfy room... Great place for business trips, students and travelers.
space: House is really in a very convenient location of Boston. It is very close almost to each corner of Boston. If you wanna travel outside of Boston it is also very convenient. You can drive, use bike or train/busses. There is 3 train station around the house, and busses, which will take you around Boston in a fastest way. Red line and purple line

(Chain grocery store, target, old navy, best by, Marshall’s, tjmax, Homedepot...) There is a lot of restaurants around the house on the Main Street which is working until late night, you can make food delivery or pick up for your own choice. There is Italian, Asian, Hispanic, American, Greek and Turkish Restaurants close by

house_rules: Dear guest please follow the house rules, it is important for us to keep our house clean and comfortable for every one. 1- no shoes at home ( feel free to bring ur own sleeper)  2- no smoking at home or at the garden  3- no extra electric Heaters or other things inside the room with out host permission. 4- please give us call one hour before reaching to our place, call or message both is fine. It is important for us as host to know the exactly arrival time of our guests. 5- no extra guest over night with out host permission. 6- please wash your dishes and clean the stove after using the kitchen  7- do not leave the hair inside the bathroom, shower, bathtub, leave the rest room and bathroom clean after use  8- you will have to share bathrooms with other guests, if you are not comfortable sharing the bathrooms with others please DO NOT BOOK this studio .  9- some people who have sensitive ears might find it little bit noisy at night because (a) this house located about 100 feet away from
host_about:
I am an architect. I am fortunate to work/study full time between great cities such as Miami, Boston, New York, Providence, Istanbul & Baku. Airbnb is a side gig. Some places are very basic, others are of great value. My places are for people traveling on a budget. I have great cohosts that will take care of you in case I am not available. I love to travel, and connect with people. This account is professionally managed. 
 
 Life Moto: 
 “We are all travelers in this world. From the sweet grass to the packing house, birth till death, we travel between the eternities.”

name: Walk to the city or beach 4
summary: Centrally located 2 family home, walking distance to the beach, restaurants, museums, colleges, bars, & historic landmarks. Access all forms of public transportation & major highways in minutes. Street parking available. *please note, there is a local tax which needs to be collected separately for all stays starting July 1, but only reservations originated before July 1,2019
space: Carpeted room located on first floor of our home . There is a king size bed that can sleep a total of 3. Free wifi, an iron , and a blow dryer . There is also a shared kitchen and bathroom.
description: Centrally located 2 family home, walking distance to the beach, restaurants, museums, colleges, bars, & historic landmarks. Access all forms of public transportation & major highways in minutes. Street parking available. *please note, there is a local tax which needs to be collected separately for all stays starting July 1, but only reservations originated before July 1,2019 Carpeted room located on first floor of our home . There is a king size bed that can sleep a total of 3. Free wifi, an iron , and a blow dryer . There is also a shared kitchen and bathroom. You can access the shared kitchen and two shared kitchens . We don't live there but live right around the corner. We are always available for questions and suggestions. You can reach us by call, text, email, or app. Our neighborhood is 2.5 miles from the city center. You can access all neighborhoods in Boston by train, bus, uber/lyft and Hubway, seasonal rental bikes. The neighborhood provides bars and restaurants, and shopping.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is 2.5 miles from the city center. You can access all neighborhoods in Boston by train, bus, uber/lyft and Hubway, seasonal rental bikes. The neighborhood provides bars and restaurants, and shopping.  There are a couple of parks close by, coffee shops, and walking distance to the beach, where you can take a nice long walk to Castle Island or JFK Library.
notes: Should you choose to stay with us please have a fully complete profile and valid ID. If you’re local to the Greater Boston area, please do not autobook and reach out to us and let us know the reason for your stay. ***Disclaimer** * Please note, as of July 1, 2019 the city of Boston as well as the State of Massachusetts will require all short term rentals to pay a collective 12.2% tax (6.5% Boston, 5.7% MA) on all reservations.  Check-in instructions will not be provided until we receive this tax via cash app prior to your stay. We will contact you a couple of days before your stay.
transit: Train, bus, Hubway(seasonal bike rentals)  Lyft and Uber, car.  The train is a 7 minute walk from our home, 3 stops to South Station and 4 to the city center.
access: You can access the shared kitchen and two shared kitchens .
interaction: We don't live there but live right around the corner. We are always available for questions and suggestions. You can reach us by call, text, email, or app.
house_rules: -Do not auto book if you live in Eastern Massachusetts.  -Make sure all doors to the building are secured and locked when leaving and entering the building  -Kitchen and all common areas to be kept clean and the way they were when you found them.  -Kitchen must be cleaned after every use out of respect for other guests. Cleaning fee does not include cleaning up dishes/utensils etc after your use.  - Balconies off limits. - No Smoking of any substances anywhere on the property  -Quiet time is 10pm (just to be respectful of other guests) -No candles -If you lose a key or lock yourself out there will be a $50 charge for us to open the door and replace the key
host_about: Stacy and I love to travel! Some of our favorite destinations are Croatia, Bosnia, Egypt, Italy, Cape Verde and Greece. Traveling comes from our love of culture and history. We love to participate in local adventures, attend events happening wherever we are, but most importantly, meet new people and try new cuisines!  Music is a huge part of our lives, all genres, and if we have down time, we kick up our feet and watch a movie! We can tell you where to go for the best restaurants and events happening around the city.  Keeping up to date with new dining and entertainment venues is something we really enjoy. We work a ton and don't get away as much as we like lately, so we love to entertain and are also Airbnb hosts.  We both have hospitality industry experience and keeping our guests happy and providing them with all of the information they need to enjoy their stay is one of the best parts of hosting. We look forward to meeting you during our travels or in the company of our home! Come stay with us and experience Boston like a local!

name: Tenean Beach area cozy room with 2 beds
summary: Friendly and Welcoming our home is a seven min drive from the beach, bowling, restaurants and novelty shops including Phillips Chocolate and  Lambert's Fruit. The apartment is spacious with porches that allow for early morning tea outside. Also a jacuzzi which makes the stay special whether in town for business or vacation. 20 minutes from downtown by car and a 10 mins walk from the Redline T Station. So whether you are coming in from Logan or South Station, you can get to us without a car.
space: Right across the street from a park that can serve as a great place for morning exercise. A stones throw from Adams Village a quaint but bustling restaurant area. Or check out local water ways and beaches. With it being right off the redline guests can explore all of BOSTON without a car.

neighborhood_overview: Convenient location at walking distance to subway, close to beach, downtown and less than 20 mn drive to Logan airport. Vibrant neighborhood with stores, restaurants , bars at walking distance. Walkable at anytime of the day. Multicultural neighborhood with friendly and humble people.  Enjoy 24 street parking in front of the house, NO meter to feed next or around the house- please pay attention to the street cleaning sign Wednesday and Thursday from midnight to 7am. Laundromat at walking distance.  Bike Rental 2 minutes away.  Church at walking distance. There is a barbershop and beauty salon near the house.
notes: Other Things to note: . Beach 8 minutes away Castle Island 10 minutes away Visit great universities: Harvard University Umass Boston MIT Boston University Boston College Northeastern University Prudential area:  - Skywalk, takes you to the 50th floor for scenic view of the city($15ish per ticket) - Christian Science reflection pool, great architectural and peaceful area. Boston Common/Swan Park/Park Street: - main large park of Boston, beautiful gardens - Downtown Crossing - Freedom Trail Begins - Great nightlife  Newburyport Street: - Food and shopping Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall/Haymarket: - great traditional Boston style foods - large selection of local produce  - Shopping, Bars, Lounges, live music  North End/Seaport Waterfront Wharf: -Little Italy, great foods and desserts, famous cannoli  - Fancy restaurants at Seaport Waterfront - Bars, Lounges Charles River/Hatch Shell/Esplanade: -area on the river where the symphony plays -nice views of the sailboats and rentals Cambridge: MIT
transit: There is 24 street parking in front of the house, NO meter to feed. From Logan airport the easiest way is to take a taxi, Uber or lyft and it will take you 15-20 minutes with no traffic . You could also take free silver line bus to south station, then switch to the Red line. Hop on the red line to Ashmont, stop at Savin Hill station. Then walk 10 minutes to the address .  If you are commuting via transportation there are buses #15 and 17 in front of the building. There are 2 buses literally right across from the house and from there you can go to the historical places in Boston Bus #15 rides about 20 minutes to Ruggles T station to catch orange line subway. The train rides about 10 minutes to the center of Boston- Downtown crossing.  Bus # 17 rides about 15 minutes to Andrew T station Red line subway. From there the train rides about 8-10 minutes to the center of Boston-downtown crossing. Also you can walk 12 minutes to Savin hill station to hop on the red line and go anywhere.  Redlin
access: The units all feature Schlage key code locks which allows greatest freedom for guests to arrive and depart as it is convenient for them. It also means no worries about losing keys! You will have access to the entire house, 3 units. Deck-outdoors area with outdoor furniture, and outdoor grill in the backyard.  You have access to the washer and dryer (coin op) in the basement. Enjoy the home as your own. Walk to nearest market and gather in fully equipped kitchen, any supplies and packed foods, watch movies and enjoy the home.  Enjoy free street parking next and around the house for multiple cars instead of paying a premium in the city . Please check the street cleaning signs from April-December on Wednesdays and Thursday(12:01-7am).
interaction: Our business model is to promote happiness, excitement, love and joy during your stay by providing a place, guide your to perfect spots to visit so you can have a memorable and fun stay in boston. Please call/text/email us for any recommendations/questions you may have.
house_rules: 1. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 10:30 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 2. Smoking allowed in the deck/balcony only. We do not allow smoking of any kind inside the house (including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine). 3.Please no parties, heavy drinking. Please No loud music. Small and responsible gatherings are allowed. Please communicate with us. 4.If you are local please do not instant book, you must communicate with us before bookings. 5. If the house is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $40 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 6.If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 12 am and 1 pm. An
host_about:
Hi! Welcome to your home! We are here to provide and facilitate so you can have the best stay in Boston! My wife and I love to welcome guests into our home!  We rent entire apartment and rooms that we decorated especially for you to feel like you are home! Our business model is to promote happiness, excitement, love and joy during your stay by providing a place, guide you to perfect spots to visit so you can have a memorable and fun stay in Boston. We go above and beyond to ensure our guests’s satisfaction. 
Something about us: I am a financial advisor, my wife is a nurse, we have 2 lovely daughters. We love people and love to travel and explore the joy of living. In short, we love to live and live to love!

neighborhood_overview: I've lived here for over 15 years, it is considered to be one of the safest and most quietest area in Dorchester, conveniently accessible via train and the bus or I93. Lots of great restaurants like Ashmont Grill and Veneria and popular lounges like Lucy's, The Industry, and Tavolo all less than half a mile away. I am always available for suggestions and recommendations to restaurants and great places for site seeing like my personal favorite, Castle Island.
notes: Street parking is very very easy and very very very safe. I've lived there over 15 years on numerous occasions, I've left my doors unlock. No worries, if you do need a private parking space, I probably can assist. ALTERNATIVELY side street cleaning on WEDNESDAY'S

Smoking is ok in the backyard away from the porch where you would have privacy and have some alone time if you desire.

name: Summer Housing (May-August) in Dorchester
summary: Second-floor condo in the charming Neponset neighborhood of Dorchester. This is great place for students in a summer program or conference attendees. It is one block away from a Stop and Shop, only a 15-minute walk to the Red Line at Fields Corner or Shawmut station (direct access to Downtown Crossing, Harvard, MIT, Tufts, Davis, Porter). It is a quiet neighborhood and a quick walk to local restaurants and nightlife (30-minute walk to Savin Hill area and 20-minute walk to Ashmont station area).
space: One furnished bedroom available in second-floor condo in the Neponset neighborhood of Dorchester for summer lease May 1 - September 1 (dates negotiable). Only a 15-minute walk to the Red Line at Fields Corner or Shawmut station (direct access to Downtown Crossing, Harvard Square, MIT, Tufts, Alewife, Davis Square and Porter Square). Quiet neighborhood and a quick walk to local restaurants and nightlife (30-minute walk to Savin Hill area and 20-minute walk to Ashmont station area). The apartment is fully furnished with recently refinished hardwood floors and a fully equipped kitchen. The bedroom includes a large walk-in closet. Your roommate is a teacher at a local school and graduate student. Rent for the room is $1500 plus utilities. I'm looking for someone to stay for at least one month.

name: Perfect location in the heart of Boston
summary: From The Esplanade that edges the Charles River to the Brownstones that line its refined streets.The neighborhood ages with grace.  This is a 3rd floor of an old typical boston building. There are 4 private bedrooms in different sizes. Shared areas are a living room, kitchen,  and 1.5 bathrooms.
space: This place is not for everyone. This is not a hotel.  There is no breakfast. This is a modest & cozy place in a prime location in the heart of Boston. You cannot beat this location. We worked extremely hard to secure this location. It is not fancy. it's an old building but it has its charm. It only has the bare necessities. People love it because it is practical and functional. Upon booking, you will get the self check in instructions.  You will be asked if you understand every step to find your room. Your room is equipped with a large bed, a desk, and desk lamp. You will be sharing the common areas (living room, kitchen and bathrooms) with other guests just like you. Your room will have fresh sheets, & a towel. The common areas are cleaned frequently but we cannot control what other guests do in regards to cleanliness, so please set expectations right. However we take things seriously and do our best to keep the common areas comfortable to everyone and we encourage you to message us i

neighborhood_overview: Boston's diverse mix of residents converge on Newbury Street, one of the city's favorite destinations for boutique shopping, casual people-watching, and urban promenading.  On Newbury Street, stores occupy the bottom-floors of the neighborhood's iconic Brownstones. When you're looking for familiar indoor shopping, take a brief walk to The Prudential Center. This cleanly-styled mall boasts over 75 high-end retailers. Saks Fifth Avenue, Lord & Taylor, Lacoste, Club Monaco, Sephora? Whether lunching, brunching, or evening snacking, Back Bay's mix of cafes, steakhouses, tapas bars, and trendy lounges leave patrons with a good taste in their mouths.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: Our apartment is located 2 min walk from JFK/Umass train station.
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner.
interaction: The major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.
house_rules: - 1. Quiet hours in the shared areas are from 10 pm to 7 am - 2. No shoes in the house - 3. Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. Leave the keys of the (self check in process) in the master lock and under the mat. This is EXTREMELY important, please. -7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. neighborhood_overview: Boston's diverse mix of residents converge on Newbury Street, one of the city's favorite destinations for boutique shopping, casual people-watching, and urban promenading.  On Newbury Street, stores occupy the bottom-floors of the neighborhood's iconic Brownstones. When you're looking for familiar indoor shopping, take a brief walk to The Prudential Center. This cleanly-styled mall boasts over 75 high-end retailers. Saks Fifth Avenue, Lord & Taylor, Lacoste, Club Monaco, Sephora? Whether lunching, brunching, or evening snacking, Back Bay's mix of cafes, steakhouses, tapas bars, and trendy lounges leave patrons with a good taste in their mouths.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: Our apartment is located 2 min walk from JFK/Umass train station.
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner.
interaction: The major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.
house_rules: - 1. Quiet hours in the shared areas are from 10 pm to 7 am - 2. No shoes in the house - 3. Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. Leave the keys of the (self check in process) in the master lock and under the mat. This is EXTREMELY important, please. -7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. We want to make it so smooth for the guests, and we would appreciate your cooperation on informing us about you

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood, Ashmont, is known for its larger Victorian style houses. All Saints Church, an Episcopal Church in Ashmont was designed by the architect Ralph Adams Cram and dedicated in 1892. It is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. Ashmont Hill Architectural Conservation District is a Boston Landmark.
notes: [1] You will have to share bathrooms with other guests and the on-site host. If you are not comfortable sharing the bathrooms with others, please do NOT book this room. [2] Some people who have sensitive ears might find it a little bit noisy at night because (a) this house is located about 100 feet away from a main avenue in Boston, and (b) despite our reminder, occasionally some less than courteous guests might still make some noise at night and this residential house was not designed with the same sound-proofing standard as the modern day hotel rooms. [3] Regardless of the length of your stay, for logistic reasons, we are only able to provide: (1) one room cleaning service prior your arrival;  (2) one set of bedding per bed, including two pillows with cases, one duvet with cover, and one flat sheet; and  (3) one bath towel per guest.
transit: This house is literally 2-min walking from Ashmont T/Metro subway station and has easy access to 93.
access: Guests have full access to all the common areas of this building, including: bathrooms on the first and second floor, kitchen on the first floor, and coin-operated laundry in the basement.
interaction: We will be always available to answer questions and provide assistance via Airbnb messaging or phone call.  #### IMPORTANT ####  Per the recommendation of Airbnb company, please contact us via Airbnb app, unless there is an emergency. Airbnb app is a requirement for making a reservation. Once you are near the house, you should be able to receive the Wifi signal and connect to it using the password we provide in our check in instructions.  When you message us on Airbnb, we will immediately be able to retrieve your booking information, and any of us who is available will message you back within a few minutes.  If there is an emergency, call the Primary Host immediately. A helper will come to assist you in 5-30 mins.  Please do NOT send us text messages to our phone number because THIS IS A LANDLINE PHONE NUMBER.  #### 重要信息 ####  和我們溝通的最佳方式是通過Airbnb手機App｡所有的客人都需要下載Airbnb手機App. 當您在這個房子附近就會接受到Wifi信號,并通過我們提供的密碼進行連接｡ 如果您通過Airbnb App給我們發送信息,我們可以立即確定您的身份和預訂,我們中的任何一個人看到以後都會及時給您回復｡ 請勿給我們發送手機短訊,因為
house_rules: - Quiet Hours: 10 pm - 8 am are quiet hours. Please do NOT make any noises during this time period.   - Animals: Please do NOT bring ANY animals to the premise.   - Security: Please be notified that common areas are under 24 hours surveillance.   - Drinking and Smoking: Please do NOT drink or smoke on the premise. - Cleanness: Please wash plates, cutlery, and cookwares after use.   - Extra Guest: Please do not bring an extra guest without the pre-approval of the host (A visitor who stays past 12 AM is considered an overnight guest).   - Internet/Wifi Use: Please do NOT use the Internet/Wifi in any manner that constitutes an infringement of any copyrighted work. Specifically, guests are not allowed to use BitTorrent and eMule on the Airbnb Wifi. We reserve the rights of reporting Internet abuses to the authorities.   - Indemnification: Guests agree to book under the understanding that the hosts are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occur while on the premises,
host_about:
Just like many of you, I have a wanderlust. I always love the adventure of travel – the unknown, something different, something new.  I have been extremely lucky to continuously feed my passion for travel. 

I love the excitement of it all–feeling like an explorer–discovering a new land, a new language, new money and all the little challenges that go along with it. When I travel, I am more spontaneous and don't live for the future or the past… just in the moment. 

I love the rush. Habitual runners get off on the kick-in of endorphins that give them that extra boost they need to keep going. I get the same jolt from a day of travel or an unexpected side trip to a new and undiscovered land that I hadn't planned to visit.  Traveling seems to give me a near constant adrenaline rush.  After a few years of uninterrupted travel, I became quite addicted to this feeling. 

I love the logistics. I like landing in a new place and trying to figure it all out myself. Where to get money. How to speak the language. How to go from point A to point B. How to pack my bag right so I don't go insane after packing it for the 135th time. 

I love meeting new people all the time. In no other time in my life have I met so many people and made so many new friends in such a short time.  The world is full of friendly, generous people. 

I love the freedom. I experience a great feeling of independence from traveling. I can go wherever I want, whenever I want. I can sleep in. I can stay out late. It's all up to me.

notes: We have other rooms available in the same property;  Garden Level: The Boiler Room: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/34422276?s=51  In Unit 1 (Ground Floor): The Map Room: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/32895915?s=51 The Elephant Room:  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/32894516?s=51 In Unit 2 (2nd and 3rd Floor): The Antler Room (2nd Floor): https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/17300316?s=51  The Buddha Room (3rd Floor): https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/17810176?s=51 Our Black Lab (Kalisi) lives in the property (2nd Floor): We own a 6 year old black lab that we brought back from Shanghai. interaction: We're happy to offer after hours check-in using a keyless and/or access code to the house. This means your late night flight is fine, but please keep in mind that check-out is at 11 AM and check-in is after 3 PM. If we are not at home, we're both just a phone call away and are always happy to help, offer advise, or assist you with whatever will make your stay with us more comfortable. Please don't hesitate to reach out at any time!
house_rules: -  Kindly remove your shoes upon entering the house. -  Please do not drag your luggage up the stairs, as this will damage the wood floors. -  Check-in is after 3PM.  Check-out before 11AM -  No food, drinking or eating in the bedrooms. -  Please purchase your own food.  There is a convenient store up the street. -  Please help us keep the house in it's pristine condition. -  Please keep toilet CLEAN after use. -  Please help us keep the bathroom clean between use by removing any hairs, wet spots or other things you wouldn't want to see yourself when using the shower or sink.  -  Common areas of the house, such as the living room, kitchen, dining room and/or washer or dryer are not to be used after 11PM or before 6AM unless with absolute silence.  Strictly no cooking or talking in common areas during those hours as it makes too much noise for other sleeping guests. -  When you are done using the kitchen, please leave no dishes or food in the sink, on counters, on the stove, or in any c
host_about:
Hi There!

We are Romo and Nayeli - a young married couple living in Boston.

We are both originally from Texas, but met and got married in China. We both love to travel and are always planning new adventures.  Anywhere we go, we are always seeking for the latest culinary experience or that perfect balanced cocktail from a local bar tender.

Right behind traveling, we both absolutely love to host!  We truly believe that hospitality is the art of making others feel welcome, comfortable, and at home.  It's the talent for spreading warmth and kindness that will be remembered always.  
 
Now, we have both lived abroad for a great part of our lives.  Nayeli spent time in Africa and went to school in France before moving to Asia.  I, on the other hand, spent time studying in Spain before moving to Beijing  in 2000 after graduating.  

Nayeli and I met in Shenzhen, China in 2010 and in 2015 we tied the knot in the great city of Shanghai.  Shortly thereafter, In 2016, we decided to repatriate back to the US after 16 years of living and working abroad.

We both had great experiences traveling in Asia, and we felt compelled to return back to the Americas and try to replicate the same adventures here at home.  We are now both very happy to be back in the US, and even more so when we get the opportunity to call Boston home.

We can't wait to meet you and host you in Boston!

If this is your first time using Airbnb, you can use this link to receive $40 off your stay: https://www.airbnb.com/c/eddier972?currency=USD

name: Single Family Home - Urban Oasis - 4 Min to Subway
summary: Take advantage of this rare opportunity to stay in a Modern Urban Farm Oasis just minutes from the subway train (Red Line) to downtown. Enjoy fresh eggs from our backyard chickens, local honey, vegetables from our garden and a lovely shady backyard with a relaxing water feature. The fully stocked kitchen is sure to delight.  Our single family 3/4 bedroom home is perfect for a family with kids of any age or can be set up to host a couple or multiple adults. Let us know what you are looking for!

name: Prices Cannot Be Beat! Walk To T, Spread Out!
summary: We are excited to host your family and friends in this eloquent & modern 5 bedroom home. Comfortable sleeping for 16 so feel free to bring large groups or a group of 5 for room to spread out! Enjoy all the full-service amenities of a 5-star hotel without the price tag. Only 5 minutes the Ashmont T Stop (Redline) from there only 15 minutes to South Station! Your home for the week comes with rare parking for 3 cars and a beautiful back private backyard!
space: Your group will have plenty of privacy throughout the house. There are 8 beds ranging from King to Twin in the 5 bedrooms. Luxury finishes and hotel quality sheets and towels also a brand new chef style kitchen. You should know, the home has 1.5 baths so one shower but two bathrooms.  We have all the essentials to make a home cooked meal. Updated, gas cooking, stainless steal appliances, and dining service for 16. Not a great cook? We can also arrange for a private chef to cook for you if you'd like.    In warmer weather you can enjoy the backyard, we are only a 5-minute walk to the Ashmont T station off the Redline so a quick ride into South Station and Downtown Boston.  2nd floor bedroom 1: one queen  2nd floor master bedroom: one king 2nd floor bedroom 3: two full beds 2nd floor small room: 1 single bed 3rd floor bedroom 4: two full beds 3rd floor bedroom 5: one full bed Still need to book a place for the Boston Marathon but don't wish to be right by the Boston Marathon Finish Line

neighborhood_overview: Avoid the hustle and bustle of Downtown Boston and enjoy your very own home only a 5 minute walk to the Ashmont T stop off the Red Line. Steps to two really great dining options, Ashmont Grill and Tavolo Restaurant.  Easy commuting to Harvard Square, Back Bay, South End, South Station, and under 2 miles from the Franklin Park Zoo and short walk to Carney Hospital. Easy T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common
notes: We cannot offer space to store your bags past 11AM on your check out day or earlier than 3PM on your arrival day. We recommend using the app called StoreMe which has luggage storage all over town. Use the promo code "bnbbos" to get $3 off the first hour of your reservation. There may not be a storage solution near the property but you should be able to find them near most T stops or perhaps by your first destination!  When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info.  We will ask you to agree to a rental agreement upon inquiring or putting in a request.  Payment is due in full at time of booking (no deposits or holds).  If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking you may click on "contact host" button to send us a message. The front entrance of the building and back
transit: NA
access: You'll love our comfy red couch, large TV with streaming capabilities, modern art throughout the house, and the original stain glass window from when the house was built in the early 1900s.  The entire house is reserved for your enjoyment. If there is anything you need during your stay we are available via phone or AirBnB messaging.
interaction: We are available 24/7 through the Airbnb app and by telephone.
house_rules: *Please DO NOT put in a booking request or instantly book if you live in the area. Contact us first by clicking on "contact host" towards the bottom of the page.*  Our goal is to create a very enjoyable stay for your trip. To do that we have a few minor requests so that you are as happy as our neighbors are. In respect to our home and our neighbors please review and accept our rental agreement:  Fines will be assessed, sometimes over your security, if you do not abide by the following rules: - Please be respectful of our neighbors by keeping noise to a normal level, reducing noise after 9:00pm, and not lingering in front of the entrance.  -All guests must be off the from deck, back deck and back yard by 8PM. Our exterior video camera may be checked to confirm this rule is being followed. Tampering with the video camera is subject to a fine.  -No additional guests without host approval  -If you live in the area, please do not instant book, contact us first.*  -No parties or events. Fine

summary: Hello! If you are in Boston for a vacation, business or just a short layover,  you are in the right place! Private 3rd floor unit with tons of sunlight. There are several private bedrooms in the house - most of which are used by other Airbnb guests, so you'll be in good company. The living room provides a great place to relax after a day of exploring, connect with other guests or just read a book on the couch.  Please note: you are renting a single private bedroom within a large Victorian.

name: Treetop appt Victorian Boston estate great area :)
summary: This beautifully meticulously restored Victorian home is spacious sunny beautiful and very unusual to survive and be brought back to original condition for your enjoyment. You can literally see how fortunate people lived over 100 years ago in this neighborhoodYour third-floor unit is Freshly renovated. The neighborhood is safe clean quiet and so convenient to downtown Boston. This is Where families want to buy into I  am raising my children here by choice. Don’t think twice You’ll love it all :)
space: Third-floor sunny spacious city apartment on a beautiful Victorian estate. One giant bedroom one large bedroom one large living area furnished tastefully A Great sized modern bathroom. Architectural Details like stained glass beautiful Honduras mahogany paneling And beautiful winding staircase
description: This beautifully meticulously restored Victorian home is spacious sunny beautiful and very unusual to survive and be brought back to original condition for your enjoyment. You can literally see how fortunate people lived over 100 years ago in this neighborhoodYour third-floor unit is Freshly renovated. The neighborhood is safe clean quiet and so convenient to downtown Boston. This is Where families want to buy into I  am raising my children here by choice. Don’t think twice You’ll love it all :) Third-floor sunny spacious city apartment on a beautiful Victorian estate. One giant bedroom one large bedroom one large living area furnished tastefully A Great sized modern bathroom. Architectural Details like stained glass beautiful Honduras mahogany paneling And beautiful winding staircase The beautiful modern kitchen is tastefully decorated and equipped with everything you should need to make a meal or just enjoy a glass of wine or mix some drinks right off the kitchen there is a nice sunn
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a tree-lined beautiful Victorian area of Boston the street is known as whiskey row by the older generation it is known that wealthy successful whiskey distillers from the Boston ( some say one being Joe Kennedy)area built some of these beautiful giant Victorian Behemoths with beautiful custom woodwork Stainglass slate and copper roofs amazing architectural features this is your chance to see how the successful Business people lived over 100 years ago. today this is still a highly sought after neighborhood for its close proximity to downtown Boston and all forms of transportation
notes: There is also a full bathroom off the kitchen and a half bathroom off the kitchen on the first floor that will be shared with other guests but you of course have your own private beautiful bathroom in your unit
transit: Uber to downtown in no time or you can walk to Savin Hill Station which is about a half a mile 7 minutes walk or Columbia/ JFK UMass station about the same distance both redline major line to downtown Boston Cambridge Harvard Square and anything else you need There are also rental bicycles one block down in front of a fabulous child’s playground
access: The beautiful modern kitchen is tastefully decorated and equipped with everything you should need to make a meal or just enjoy a glass of wine or mix some drinks right off the kitchen there is a nice sunny back deck where you can sit and talk quietly in addition to your private bathrooms and your unit there is a bath and a half that is shared with other guests off the front hall and kitchen the front foyer and hallway is literally breathtaking for its size scale and how meticulously it has been brought back as if in a time capsule the covered front porch is an absolute luxury to sit on a rocker out of the weather but still in the environment just like someone would have years ago
interaction: I leave this up to the guest if you would like to meet me and get some recommendations please ask. if I am in the area  I like to check people in if I can but I generally like to give you your space do  not feel you are bothering me by sending me a text or give me a call if you need to know a good spot to eat a good way to travel or any other kind of business or activity I know the city like the back of my hand
house_rules: NO PARTYS NO SMOKING(ANYTHING) No locals (Massachusetts) without telling me why your staying local. Be prepared to show a photo ID on check in I just want to know the profile and the person coming to my home are the same. 1 PARKING SPOT per reservation. No one that is not on the Airbnb contract is allowed in the home without express permission first from me. As far as your state goes I’m going to ask guests to take shoes off there are old fruit boxes in the foyer you can store your shoes in or carry them up to your unit please be respectful of your surroundings do not leave your personal affects around the public areas of the home keep it in your own unit and whatever you use please put it back exactly where you found it in the way you found it at the end of your stay  ANY TRASH YOU GENERATE  or food remnants put in the trash barrel out by the car park. Thank you
host_about: I am joseph I have lived in this area my whole life and I have restored this property back to its original splendor it was a labor of love and it took a very long time to do it I hope you enjoy it

name: Couch in a Sweet Apartment in South Boston
summary: I live in a lovely bright and airy apartment with lots of plants in South Boston. I am offering a comfy couch and a friendly safe space to enjoy while you are traveling. I have everything a guest might need and am happy to share whatever I can. Please be aware I have a lovely kitty!
space: There is a kitchen, a full bath and another half bathroom that would be shared between myself, my roommate, and my guest. You would be sleeping on the couch in the living room. The couch is quite comfortable - I’ve spent several nights sleeping on it myself! I have extra pillows and blankets should you require them.
description: I live in a lovely bright and airy apartment with lots of plants in South Boston. I am offering a comfy couch and a friendly safe space to enjoy while you are traveling. I have everything a guest might need and am happy to share whatever I can. Please be aware I have a lovely kitty! There is a kitchen, a full bath and another half bathroom that would be shared between myself, my roommate, and my guest. You would be sleeping on the couch in the living room. The couch is quite comfortable - I’ve spent several nights sleeping on it myself! I have extra pillows and blankets should you require them. Guests are allowed in the common areas and bathrooms. The two bedrooms are private areas. I work full time but have a scattered schedule. I enjoy spending time at home, cooking, painting, singing, and cuddling with my cat. I am happy to be around to socialize or entertain guests or show them around Boston. We are near the JFK/UMass T stop on the Red Line in South Boston. The Red Line takes you d
neighborhood_overview: We are near the JFK/UMass T stop on the Red Line in South Boston. The Red Line takes you directly downtown in about 10 or 15 minutes.  We have a convenience store, liquor store, pizza shop, Irish pub, and laundromat all within short walking distance.
notes: I have a lovely kitty named Bellatrix who would love to cuddle with you and be your friend. Please be aware in case you have allergies!
transit: Temporary parking on the street is free if you can find a space! I don’t have a car but would be happy to help my guests with directions for taking the T.
access: Guests are allowed in the common areas and bathrooms. The two bedrooms are private areas.
interaction: I work full time but have a scattered schedule. I enjoy spending time at home, cooking, painting, singing, and cuddling with my cat. I am happy to be around to socialize or entertain guests or show them around Boston.
house_rules: No shoes in the apartment, there is a shoe rack in the front hall to keep your shoes No smoking in or around the property No overnight guests or unapproved extra guests  Clean up after yourself and keep the toilet seats closed and we should get along fine
host_about: I’m an American post-grad currently living in Boston but always planning for my next adventure abroad! I love food, beer, music, and art and I love to explore!

neighborhood_overview: Convenient location at walking distance to subway, close to beach, downtown and less than 20 mn drive to Logan airport. Vibrant neighborhood with stores, restaurants , bars at walking distance. Walkable at anytime of the day. Multicultural neighborhood with friendly and humble people.  Enjoy 24 street parking in front of the house, NO meter to feed next or around the house- please pay attention to the street cleaning sign Wednesday and Thursday from midnight to 7am. Laundromat at walking distance.  Bike Rental 2 minutes away.  Church at walking distance. There is a barbershop and beauty salon near the house.
notes: NA
transit: There is 24 street parking in front of the house, NO meter to feed. From Logan airport the easiest way is to take a taxi, Uber or lyft and it will take you 15-20 minutes with no traffic . You could also take free silver line bus to south station, then switch to the Red line. Hop on the red line to Ashmont, stop at Savin Hill station. Then walk 10 minutes to the address .  If you are commuting via transportation there are buses #15 and 17 in front of the building. There are 2 buses literally right across from the house and from there you can go to the historical places in Boston Bus #15 rides about 20 minutes to Ruggles T station to catch orange line subway. The train rides about 10 minutes to the center of Boston- Downtown crossing.  Bus # 17 rides about 15 minutes to Andrew T station Red line subway. From there the train rides about 8-10 minutes to the center of Boston-downtown crossing. Also you can walk 12 minutes to Savin hill station to hop on the red line and go anywhere.  Redlin

summary: This beautifully meticulously restored Victorian home is spacious sunny beautiful and very unusual to survive and be brought back to original condition for your enjoyment. You can literally see how fortunate people lived over 100 years ago in this neighborhoodYour first floor unit is Freshly renovated. The neighborhood is safe clean quiet and so convenient to downtown Boston. This is Where families want to buy into I  am raising my children here by choice. Don’t think twice You’ll love it all :)
space: First-floor sunny spacious city suite  on a beautiful Victorian estate. Two large bedrooms and a nice private bathroom Architectural Details like stained glass beautiful Natural wood work.The kitchen in this home is shared with other guests of all you’re sleeping suite and private bathroom are a separate locked unit for yourself The beautiful modern kitchen is tastefully decorated and equipped with everything you should need to make a meal or just enjoy a glass of wine or mix some drinks right
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a tree-lined beautiful Victorian area of Boston the street is known as whiskey row by the older generation it is known that wealthy successful whiskey distillers from the Boston ( some say one being Joe Kennedy)area built some of these beautiful giant Victorian Behemoths with beautiful custom woodwork Stainglass slate and copper roofs amazing architectural features this is your chance to see how the successful Business people lived over 100 years ago. today this is still a highly sought after neighborhood for its close proximity to downtown Boston and all forms of transportation
notes: There is also a full bathroom off the kitchen and a half bathroom off the kitchen on the first floor that will be shared with other guests but you of course have your own private beautiful bathroom in your suite
transit: Uber to downtown in no time or you can walk to Savin Hill Station which is about a half a mile 7 minutes walk or Columbia/ JFK UMass station about the same distance both redline major line to downtown Boston Cambridge Harvard Square and anything else you need There are also rental bicycles one block down in front of a fabulous child’s playground
access: The beautiful modern kitchen is tastefully decorated and equipped with everything you should need to make a meal or just enjoy a glass of wine or mix some drinks right off the kitchen there is a nice sunny back deck where you can sit and talk quietly in addition to your private bathrooms in your unit there is a bath and a half that is shared with other guests off the front hall and kitchen the front foyer and hallway is literally breathtaking for its size scale and how meticulously it has been brought back as if in a time capsule the covered front porch is an absolute luxury to sit on a rocker out of the weather but still in the environment just like someone would have years ago
interaction: I leave this up to the guest if you would like to meet me and get some recommendations please ask. if I am in the area  I like to check people in if I can but I generally like to give you your space do  not feel you are bothering me by sending me a text or give me a call if you need to know a good spot to eat a good way to travel or any other kind of business or activity I know the city like the back of my hand
house_rules: NO PARTYS NO SMOKING(ANYTHING) No locals (Massachusetts) without telling me why your staying local. Be prepared to show a photo ID on check in I just want to know the profile and the person coming to my home are the same.  1 PARKING SPOT per reservation Ask if you need more there may be something for rent in the area No one that is not on the Airbnb contract is allowed in the home without express permission first from me.  I’m going to ask guests to take shoes off there are old fruit boxes in the foyer you can store your shoes in or carry them up to your unit please keep to your own area/ and The designated shared spaces please be respectful of your surroundings and whatever you use please put it back exactly where you found it in the way you found it at the end of your stay  ANY TRASH YOU GENERATE   or food remnants put in the trash barrel out by the car park. Thank you
host_about: I am joseph I have lived in this area my whole life and I have restored this property back to its original splendor it was a labor of love and it took a very long time to do it I hope you enjoy it

The 2nd floor  has a 2 bedroom unit. It has an open office/living/dining area with another full kitchen and 2 bedrooms and another rear deck as well. There is plenty of street parking in front of the house without any parking restrictions.

summary: This beautifully meticulously restored Victorian home is spacious sunny beautiful and very unusual to survive and be brought back to original condition for your enjoyment. You can literally see how fortunate people lived over 100 years ago in this neighborhoodYour Second floor unit is Freshly renovated. The neighborhood is safe clean quiet and so convenient to downtown Boston. This is Where families want to live I  am raising my children here by choice. Don’t think twice You’ll love it all :)
space: First-floor sunny spacious city suite  on a beautiful Victorian estate. Two large bedrooms and a nice private bathroom Architectural Details like stained glass beautiful Natural wood work.

The beautiful modern kitchen is tastefully decorated and equipped with everything you should need to make a meal or just enjoy a glass of wine or mix some drinks right off the kitchen there is a nice sunny back deck where you can sit and talk quietly in addition to your private bathrooms in your unit there is a
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a tree-lined beautiful Victorian area of Boston the street is known as whiskey row by the older generation it is known that wealthy successful whiskey distillers from the Boston ( some say one being Joe Kennedy)area built some of these beautiful giant Victorian Behemoths with beautiful custom woodwork Stainglass slate and copper roofs amazing architectural features this is your chance to see how the successful Business people lived over 100 years ago. today this is still a highly sought after neighborhood for its close proximity to downtown Boston and all forms of transportation
notes: There is also a full bathroom off the kitchen and a half bathroom off the kitchen on the first floor that will be shared with other guests but you of course have your own private beautiful bathroom in your suite
transit: Uber to downtown in no time or you can walk to Savin Hill Station which is about a half a mile 7 minutes walk or Columbia/ JFK UMass station about the same distance both redline major line to downtown Boston Cambridge Harvard Square and anything else you need There are also rental bicycles one block down in front of a fabulous child’s playground
access: The beautiful modern kitchen is tastefully decorated and equipped with everything you should need to make a meal or just enjoy a glass of wine or mix some drinks right off the kitchen there is a nice sunny back deck where you can sit and talk quietly in addition to your private bathrooms in your unit there is a bath and a half that is shared with other guests off the front hall and kitchen the front foyer and hallway is literally breathtaking for its size scale and how meticulously it has been brought back as if in a time capsule the covered front porch is an absolute luxury to sit on a rocker out of the weather but still in the environment just like someone would have years ago
interaction: I leave this up to the guest if you would like to meet me and get some recommendations please ask. if I am in the area  I like to check people in if I can but I generally like to give you your space do  not feel you are bothering me by sending me a text or give me a call if you need to know a good spot to eat a good way to travel or any other kind of business or activity I know the city like the back of my hand
house_rules: NO PARTYS NO SMOKING(ANYTHING) No locals (Massachusetts) without telling me why your staying local. Be prepared to show a photo ID on check in I just want to know the profile and the person coming to my home are the same.  1 PARKING SPOT per reservation Ask if you need more there may be something for rent in the area No one that is not on the Airbnb contract is allowed in the home without express permission first from me.  I’m going to ask guests to take shoes off there are old fruit boxes in the foyer you can store your shoes in or carry them up to your unit please keep to your own area/ and The designated shared spaces please be respectful of your surroundings and whatever you use please put it back exactly where you found it in the way you found it at the end of your stay  ANY TRASH YOU GENERATE   or food remnants put in the trash barrel out by the car park. Thank you
host_about: I am joseph I have lived in this area my whole life and I have restored this property back to its original splendor it was a labor of love and it took a very long time to do it I hope you enjoy it

name: Gadwall Suite
summary: STR383328 This AirBNB is in the great location of Lower Mills near the historic Baker Chocolate Factory; the first chocolate factory in the United States. Adams Square with its shops, Shaw’s supermarket and restaurants is a five-minute walk away.  Milton Village is equally as close with two banks, post office and other amenities. The back yard is landscaped with honeysuckle bushes, lilac bushes and evergreen trees on around one half acre of land with a 20’ by 17’ foot deck.
space: *The bedroom have an internal lock but not an external lock. The bedroom can not be locked from the outside.*

host_about:
Hello my name is Clifford. Nice to meet you! I enjoy getting out of the house to see festivals, art, museums, concerts, harbor events, cultural events and anything else fun around town. 

As an Airbnb guest, I know it’s nice to have a safe and comfortable place to rest after a fun day or night out and about. This is better than a hotel or motel experience.

Walking distance to a couple of great restaurants, (Savin Bar; HARP&BARD). Staying close to the center of South Boston, there are a number of well regarded fine dining restaurants and bars Provided for Guests at no extra cost: - Italian coffee/espresso machine with coffee beans - Electrical Massage chair in the living room - White noise machine in the bedroom - Hair Dryer - Blender - Full Kitchen I live and work in Boston for the past 11 years and happy to give pointers on activities, restaurants, and things to do in Boston. There is an automatic lock on the door. A new code is generated with each booking and you will be provided your code prior to arrival. Proximity to destinations
neighborhood_overview: Proximity to destinations of interest: 1. The Boston airport is 7 miles away and that's a 15-minute drive in normal traffic. 2. The BCEC (Boston Convention & Exhibition Center) is 3 miles away or a 10-minute drive.  3. The closest subway ("T") stop is at Savin Hill (red line) 0.2 miles away or a 4-minute walk, next closest is the JFK/UMass stop (red line) that is 0.4 miles away or a 7-minute walk. This red line subway takes you to downtown Boston and Cambridge/MIT/Harvard.  4. Carson Beach and the Joe Moakley sports park is 1.0 mile away or 20-minute walk. 5. Boston Common - the central park of Boston is 3.3 miles away or 15-minute drive in normal traffic. 6. Harvard and MIT are easily within reach via the subway - including walking to the subway at Andrew Square, about 33   and 23 minutes to each respectively.  7. The center of South Boston is only 2 miles away or a 40-minute walk - when you get there to Broadway - go either East or West and you'll find a great selection of wonderful
notes: NA
transit: You can easily get around by walking to the nearest points of interest (see list above), taking public transportation (red line), and by driving or taking a short distance uber ride.

name: Spacious 2 bedroom condo, centrally located!
summary: Bright, open and sunny 2nd floor apartment, located close to downtown Boston.  Perfect for a commute into downtown Boston, this unit is conveniently located and provides a comfortable stay, just steps outside of downtown Boston.
space: You'll find a comfortable city oasis here in Dorchester. The 2nd floor privacy, spacious common area and ample lighting will make you feel right at home.
description: Bright, open and sunny 2nd floor apartment, located close to downtown Boston.  Perfect for a commute into downtown Boston, this unit is conveniently located and provides a comfortable stay, just steps outside of downtown Boston. You'll find a comfortable city oasis here in Dorchester. The 2nd floor privacy, spacious common area and ample lighting will make you feel right at home. You will have access to the entire unit, including the laundry room! The kitchen is fully stocked with pots and pans, and everything you need to cook with. Also included is an espresso machine and a toaster oven. I will be available by phone or email during your stay. If assistance is required, the host will meet the guest at the location of the apartment. Dorchester is Boston's most up and coming neighborhood, offering a diverse and historic community very conveniently located to all transportation, as well as nearby neighborhood amenities. The benefit of staying in Dorchester is more space, for less money, w
neighborhood_overview: Dorchester is Boston's most up and coming neighborhood, offering a diverse and historic community very conveniently located to all transportation, as well as nearby neighborhood amenities. The benefit of staying in Dorchester is more space, for less money, without the hustle and bustle of downtown life.
notes: We are located near the local police station so sometimes you can hear sirens going by, it's the city after all!
transit: Just a 5 minute walk down the street is the Fields Corner MBTA subway station (runs every 10 minutes), where you can take a short 20 minute ride into downtown Boston for only $2.60 each way! Also at the Fields Corner station is a local City Bike share station, where you can rent a bike for only $2.50/hour.  Alternatively, Uber or driving is also an option. We have two designated parking spaces behind the building, and we are located only 5 minutes from the major highway, I93.
access: You will have access to the entire unit, including the laundry room! The kitchen is fully stocked with pots and pans, and everything you need to cook with. Also included is an espresso machine and a toaster oven.
interaction: I will be available by phone or email during your stay. If assistance is required, the host will meet the guest at the location of the apartment.
house_rules: To be respectful of the neighbors, please be conscious of any loud noises in building common areas Quiet hours are after 10:00pm The dining room furniture is an antique, please use a table cloth and placemats when using it. No more than 4 guests allowed during the stay
host_about:
I am a Designer and Artist living in the Dorchester area of Boston, Massachusetts, USA. I enjoy traveling, cooking, painting, going to museums, as well as a fun night out with friends.

I like to travel somewhere new in the world at least once a year, solo, or with friends! 

I used to host my former apartment with AirBNB so I know what it’s like to be a respectful guest as well as a host. 

PS - I’m a pro at finding a great airfare deal, ask me what my trick is!

name: Entire top floor living in vibrant Boston!
summary: I'm a Canadian transplant who has come to love everything Boston has to offer. I live what many call the next Williamsburg or Mission District of Boston-- Savin Hill. Conveniently located 2-mins from transit and a 12-min walk to Savin Hill Red Line station (15 mins if you take your time), this area is perfect for folks who want to enjoy downtown without the cost.  It's a great place to come home to after an evening out and the perfect space to start your Sundays as you get ready for brunch.
space: The space has a keyless entry, which means you'll get a special code to enter both the front and back door.  There is also a front and back deck for you to enjoy a good book or some music.
description: I'm a Canadian transplant who has come to love everything Boston has to offer. I live what many call the next Williamsburg or Mission District of Boston-- Savin Hill. Conveniently located 2-mins from transit and a 12-min walk to Savin Hill Red Line station (15 mins if you take your time), this area is perfect for folks who want to enjoy downtown without the cost.  It's a great place to come home to after an evening out and the perfect space to start your Sundays as you get ready for brunch. The space has a keyless entry, which means you'll get a special code to enter both the front and back door.  There is also a front and back deck for you to enjoy a good book or some music. I love helping people discover the great things about Boston. Feel free to ask me questions via text. I work during the day at a college that doesn't take summers off. So my availability isn't as free as I'd like. That being said, I will be available to respond to your questions and requests  During the summer, I'
neighborhood_overview: Let's be really clear here-- this is not a luxury high rise. Jeeves won't be at your beck and call and we don't serve mimosas at breakfast (although, there may be some champagne in the fridge *wink*).  It's a stylish apartment that comes as close as you'll get to living in one of Boston's most diverse and vibrant neighborhoods.  The convenience store is a 2-min walk away, there's laundry in the basement and a deck in the front and the back. So, there are PLENTY of opportunities to interact with the neighbors, who are all wonderful people. But if you want to keep to yourself, you can do that too.
notes: NA
transit: The 15 bus to Ruggles is just outside the door, as is the 17 to Andrew station. So you can get to opposite sides of the city from my place. Also, Savin Hill train station is a 12 minute walk away.
access: NA
interaction: I love helping people discover the great things about Boston. Feel free to ask me questions via text. I work during the day at a college that doesn't take summers off. So my availability isn't as free as I'd like. That being said, I will be available to respond to your questions and requests  During the summer, I'll be commuting between Boston and New York for work. So, this space is better suited to guests who are familiar with the city and/or don't require a 24/7 concierge experience.
house_rules: Absolutely, no shoes in the house. No smoking on-site. No additional guests in the unit without permission. No pets allowed.  Quiet hours are between 11 pm and 8 am. Please do not cook or fry any meat in the house.
