name: Top floor living near Boston’s  Savin Hill!
summary: I'm a Canadian transplant who loves everything Boston has to offer. If you enjoy being steps from one of Boston's most vibrant neighborhoods, Savin Hill, then you'll definitely love my space.  The space is tastefully appointed, with everything you need to work, sleep and relax.  You'll be just a 12 min walk to Savin Hill subway station on the Red Line and 2 minutes to the bus, which makes this spot the right balance of affordability and convenience (if that's your thing).
space: So, let's be reeeeaallllly clear here: This is not Harvard Square (although, you can get there from Savin Hill station). You won't find rich and famous professors or tech bros (no offense) strolling down the street buying green  juice from the local juice bar.   What you'll find is a beautiful crash pad, just steps away from public transit-- transit that can take you east or west. Downtown crossing is 6 subway stops away and south station is 5.  "So, Toni, what about the convinces?!?" you ask. Well, there's currently a new condo development happening around the corner, where Starbucks and Whole Foods are slated for arrival. However, that won't be ready for a while. So, for now, you'll have to settle for K-cups and Sodastream, chez moi (that's French for "at my place").

name: Blue Screen - Modern Condo with Amazing City Views
summary: Want to experience the rich history, nature, and industry of Boston? Live like a local at the Blue Screen, a beautifully furnished, brand new, modern luxury condo located at the heart of the historic Ashmont neighborhood. Located within steps of a Red Line MBTA train station, exploring Boston will be a breeze.
space: The condo is furnished with a comfortable couch for lounging, complete with a state of the art ultra high definition Smart TV with unlimited cable channels and a Playstation 4. A clean, spacious kitchen complete with a modern stove, oven, microwave, fridge, freezer, and dishwasher are available to you.

name: Eclectic and Private 1-2 Bedroom with Porches
summary: Rent our eclectic and cozy 1-2 bedroom second-floor apartment home. Enjoy dinner and relaxing on the sunny front porch, cook in our well-equipped kitchen, or entertain in our living and dining space, with a down-filled sectional, teak dining table, and comfortable dining chairs. Use the den for TV watching or as a second bedroom. Our home is best for up to four adults looking for a comfortable home base during your trip to Boston. It's great for entertaining if you have friends in the area.
space: This apartment is the top floor of a two-family home in the Dorchester neighborhood of Boston. Our neighborhood has a leafy suburban feel, but is within a 10-minute walk of great local restaurants and the red line MBTA train.  The apartment is a two-bedroom, but we have it set up as a 1-bedroom with a more formal living and dining area and a den with television and a very comfortable memory-foam Queen-sized pull-out couch.

neighborhood_overview: We love our Dorchester neighborhood. We're near a nice park and near several Dorchester neighborhoods with great restaurants. Our favorites include Tavolo Italian-American Bistro, Yellow Door Taqueria in Lower Mills, Ashmont Grill with a great patio, and Molinari's a great and reasonably-priced family Italian place. We're conveniently near the MBTA red line, on a bus route, and minutes from the highway (Rte. 93). We're a 20-minute drive into Boston (depending on traffic), and about 25 minutes on the T. The red line also goes to Cambridge and Somerville.
notes: There may be other Airbnb guests in the first-floor apartment. We have two dogs (about 50 pounds and about 70 pounds). They are both friendly, but our younger, large, white dog is excitable and sometimes barks...very occasionally he has been known to bark at guests, but he's not aggressive, just a scaredy cat dumb-dumb.
transit: We're conveniently near the MBTA red line, on a bus route, and minutes from the highway (Rte. 93). We're a 20-minute drive into Boston (depending on traffic), and about 25 minutes on the T. The red line also goes to Cambridge and Somerville.
access: Guests have the whole second floor to themselves and a private entrance with a lockbox for keeping keys. There will be other Airbnb guests on the first floor, and we live on the ground/garden level with our two dogs. We use the backyard space, but you'll have access to two second-floor porches (one with shade and one with sun).
interaction: We are in the garden level in-law suite this summer, so we are available if anything is needed, but we tend to let guests do their own thing.
house_rules: We ask for quiet after 10 pm on weekdays and 11 pm on weekends. We also ask for relative quiet prior to 9 am on weekdays and 10 am on weekends. We live in the building and there are additional Airbnb guests on the first floor.
host_about: Hi! I'm a 30-something Bostonian with a husband and two dogs. I have ties to Maine (grew up there), Cape Cod (family and college summers), and San Francisco (family). I love to travel, but mostly I work (educational media).
